author: danderson
msg: * STATUS (r19620): Vote and move to the approved section.

author: dlr
msg: * STATUS: Nominate r19688.

author: dlr
msg: Fix issue #2403, incorrect 3-way merge of "added" binary file which
already exists in the repository and WC.  Problem scenario:
1. Perform a 3-way merge into your WC (using two URLs), where the
left/older side doesn't contain the file being merged, and the
right/newer side is identical to the content in your WC.
2. Merge does not report a conflict.
3. WC is left in a conflicted state.
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c
(struct merge_cmd_baton): New flag indicating to merge_file_changed
that it was invoked from merge_file_added, which is important for
detecting whether the left side of a 3-way merge actually exists.
(merge_file_changed): If the 'left' side of the merge doesn't exist
in the repository, and the 'right' side of the merge is identical
to the WC, pretend we did the merge (a no-op).
(merge_file_added): Set add_necessitated_merge to TRUE before
calling merge_file_changed().
(svn_client_merge2, svn_client_merge_peg2): Initialize
add_necessitated_merge to FALSE.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_tests.py
(three_way_merge_add_of_existing_binary_file): New regression test.
(test_list): Add three_way_merge_add_of_existing_binary_file.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svntest/actions.py
(run_and_verify_merge2): A refactored variation of the
run_and_verify_merge() function which can take two URL parameters
for use in a three-way merge.
(run_and_verify_merge): Delegate to run_and_verify_merge2().
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svntest/wc.py
(State.subtree): New method to create a deep copy of a sub-tree of a
State object.  Convenient for using the greek tree as a base State
definition.
Review by: lundblad
rooneg
julianfoad
sussman
